Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location, not a 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: travelwithgg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights. While the hotel itself is not top luxury, we didn't mind due to the price and location. Bonus that there is a bus stop right infront of the hotel, and walking distance from everything! The staff was of average attitude, not what you expect as cheerfulness and deisre to fufil all your requests but they where helpful. Breakfast was a so so array of pastries, cereals, meats and cheeses. Our tv and heater worked and we had a beautiful balcony in our room. This hotel is not a 5 star luxury resort, but as I said I didn't mind since we spend little to no time in the hotel and most of our time exploring the city. The location is the reason why I will return, only a 5 minute walt to the Vatican and many other Roman points of interest!

Reviews.Title: “Rude service, cramped room”
Reviews.Author: anothermkegrl
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I booked this hotel about a month before our trip. We needed a place to stay for one night before our study abroad program began. I arrived at the hotel after the three girls had. I was very confused about it's location. There is a sign outside of the building above a random driveway. Aside from the sign, there is no direction about how to proceed. At the end of the driveway, there is a small elevator. It only fits one person with luggage. In the elevator, I believe there was a sign that said what floor the hotel was on. Once I found the hotel, I had to ring a bell for service at the front desk. The man told me what room my friends were in, but upon wandering around the confusing hallways, I couldn't find it. Eventually, I had him personally walk me there. The room had four beds in it, which were more like cots. This room was not meant for four people and their luggage. It was not comfortable. The stand-up shower and bathroom in general were clean, surprisingly. We had trouble locking our door with the old key, but it worked once we figured it out. The wifi password system is confusing and doesn't work. We paid too much for so little. $200 Euro for the night altogether for 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Lying and Impolite Staff”
Reviews.Author: nguyenvuthiennga
Reviews.Content: It was terrible staying. When we booked the room, they told us there would be air conditioner. However, there was nothing and then we talked to a guy there. He took us to another room with a fan and kept saying that was an air conditioner!!!! It was late at night, so we had to accept. The day after, we tried to talk to another guy and we finally changed to a room with air conditioner but the room was really small. Most of staff were very impolite, answering without smile (sometimes with anger)! We would never return!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Romabella87
Reviews.Content: Information about this hotel is misleading from web description. Ara Pacis is overpriced , filthy , smelly place . Peeling wallpaper everywhere, very tiny washroom, spoted mattress , Do I need to say more ? We ordered pick up from Fiumicino , driver was 40 min late with old no air conditioning Jaguar , we paid 55 euro . There is small clean buss - 40 euro.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star in a great location....”
Reviews.Author: lid_9
Reviews.Content: First impression was note great, but got better - I arrived late on Saturday night and they had limited rooms left. So, they changed me (from Room #3 to #11) on Sunday and it was a lot brighter and larger, with a much better & cleaner bathroom.I stayed a week, and it was fine for the price - on hindsight I might have searched for other location, but it would have been pricier. It was a 3-star; the hotel staff were helpful and friendly enough, and breakfast was ok. There were marvelous large marble steps to the Hotel, which was on 3rd floor of the building. There was an elevator and it was old, but worked fine. Location was super, as it was easy to walk everywhere. I walked about 10 minutes down the Tiber River towards St. Peter's & Vatican daily - beautiful view. This is Rome...there are neat places, and it had character. It was clean. WiFi was free and worked in the lobby area - staff said it didn't in most rooms - other friends stayed in hotels which charged 11 - 14 euros/day for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: LuckbethisLady
Reviews.Content: First, we moved to this hotel after our original hotel The Borromeo (see my review there) didn't have enough rooms for the weekend and we hadn't booked in advance. The Borromeo was much much better in every aspect but this place wasn't too bad either. Yes, the place is dingy, the walls are crumbling, but it's clean and doesn't smell. There's no AC, which was a bit of a problem in end of June heat in a room with no windows but it wasn't unbearable. We switched rooms upon arrival to one with a shared terrace and that made it all worth it. The sunrise was breathtaking from the balcony and it was a perfect place to start the day in beautiful Rome. The hotel is also located just 5 min down the street from the Vatican and only 10 min away from the Spanish steps so it's a pretty good base for exploring historic areas. All in all, it's a great option during high season when everything is booked or pricey but if you can find them, there's definitely better places around for similar prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but noisy...”
Reviews.Author: Michelle4_10
Reviews.Content: Great location near all the attractions in Rome, we could walk to almost everything within about 20 minutes. Room was very small for four adults and was extremely noisy. Air conditioning would only work about half the night and then you had to have the windows open which meant no sleeping because of the noise! Staff was friendly and breakfast was good

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste yur money”
Reviews.Author: dmarx706
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace. It was filthy, falling apart, peeling wallpaper, paint chips everywhere. Everything is worn, frayed and smells. It is an absolute fire hazard. To their credit they did try and move our rooms, but it was insult to injury. They ended up moving us to another hotel, at their expense, that was acceptable. They also charged 50 euro for airport pickup when the regular cab fare is 40. It was a rough start after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT ANY COST!”
Reviews.Author: Thong002
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my husband and my little 18month old boy in February 09. We booked the accommodatoin on wotif and it was the worst choice ever. Not knowing how horrible the experience would be, it was the longest 5 nights of my life. First there was not even a microwave to heat up my son's milk, and they weren't willing to help out. So i needed to go to the front dest and ask for boiled water to heat up his milk everytime i needed it. The bathroom was small and stank bad. This made the whole room stink like a male toilet cubical. The room was old and so in need of rennovation. The sheets were yuk and the man at the reception was not friendly. Everything in that room was old and horrible. To top things up with my stay I had to be sick with vomiting and the runs! It was the last place you want to be in when you're sick. Breakfast was very limited and internet didn't always work. I don't recommend this place to anyone. I regret staying for that long, this made my experience in Rome not so good. We got desperate and wanted to leave, but knew we have already paid for it and we wouldn't get the rest of our money back. Each night I would dreaded going back to the smelly hotel room! I think I have said enough!

Reviews.Title: “visit off-season”
Reviews.Author: AnsiaAthens
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Rome with a friend, since we found an incredible last-minute offer for airline tickets.(ATH-FCO-ATH 57 Euro :-) ) Since this trip was not planned, we had only a little money to spend. We were indroduced to this hotel by a tourist kiosk at the airport which provides shuttle bus service. We told the agent that we wanted something cheap but in an area that is not dangerous for two girls to walk. It is located in a really strange building. You walk by a corridor to take the elevator and go to the third floor. We found this building very interesting yet wierd; we couldn't find out if there was any other person staying in it. Our room was small but not in a way that we couln't agree with that. It was charmingly decorated and clean. I didn't like very much the bathroom, we had to shower in a really small place. (I don't know the english word for it). The curtain was flooding in my feet as I was showering myself. The room got a little bit hot at night. The breakfast hasn't got any variety at all, but we didn't want to take breakfast anyway. The worst thing in this hotel is the staff. They seem to be bored and that they don't want to help you in any way. We wanted them to tell us us things to do in the area and they just showed us a map telling us to find it all by ourselves. They all seemed a little bit rude, and they speak very litlle english. (in Greece, were I come from, there is no way a receptionist doesn't speak fluent english). The best thing was the location. You could go to the Vatican Museum and the city center on foot, in a very little distance. It was a very good area, and we weren't frightened at all to walk at night alone. We stayed there 2 nights, and I stayed alone for one more night after my friend left. When she left, I paid the same price even though I was only one person. It was very cheap, we paid 50 euro per room each day. (it was off season). I think that this price were extremely good for this hotel, I stayed in other hotels that were not as good as this and paid more. If you visit Rome off-season and you seek for an acceptable place to stay, I think it is a good idea to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Hideous Hotel I've Ever Stayed In... And I'm No Snob!”
Reviews.Author: robscott_ade
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives: Great location, with in walking distance of just about anything you would want to see in this beautiful city! The rest is terrible. Bad service, horrible dark, dingy rooms. Tired, disgusting decor. I asked to move rooms straight away and did so with-out question as to why i wanted to move. As if they needed to ask, they knew they were taking the micky... €145 per night for that tiny dump! i would have expected more from a youth hostel. I wouldn't have fed the breakfast to my dog! I usually can only afford 3* but thus was 1* at a push. On top of all this there was constant work on the floor above the hotel with drilling and banging from 7am which we were not informed of when booking and which the hotel staff thought was not a problem and couldn't even muster a tiny hint of sympathy let alone an apology! AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Checked in and checked straight back out”
Reviews.Author: Posh101
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for a romantic weekend in Rome. Hotel was possibly the worst I have ever seen. Very strange entrance via courtyard with a sign pointing to the Lift for the Hotel entrance. You have to go up to the 3rd floor to access the hotel. Rude receptionist who mumbled out the time of breakfast. Corradore to the room had ripped wallpaper and grotty thread bare carpet. The room was grotesque and smelt like someone had died in it. Can't believe somewhere like this can exist. Just don't go

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: wendievan
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel early (by an hour) and was rudely turned away, until check-in. Our bed had bed bugs, the shower over-flowed and there was just one employee at the desk who was willing to help us, or answer any questions we had. The charges posted for the hotel shuttle are not correct, (when we inquired, the price was significantly higher then what was posted) and the room was so small there was no where to even keep one suitcase open. They advertise internet, but you only get it if you ask for it and only in the lobby area. Overall, we couldn't wait to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: flyawayseattle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here. The staff made us feel welcome. Minutes to everywhere. This hotel had a great location to the Vatican area and we felt safe walking around. We will definitely stay here again when we come back.. Thanks, P. Nguyen

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: Barbara098
Reviews.Content: Although the building is elegant and in a good position the hotel is in a state of disrepair. The air-con was absolutely useless and no attempt was made to fix it; the wallpaper was peeling off the walls and the carpet was in holes. The attitude of the day manager was unbelievable - he was rude, disinterested and just shrugged if you asked him anything.The breakfasts were rather special too - in a country that prides itself on its coffee, the muck that they served was beyond description. It was no better than some of the hostels my son had just stayed in in Morocco and a lot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MonZor
Reviews.Content: The ONLY good thing about this hotel was that it had an elevator. Other than that, the carpet throughout the hotel is dark, old and dirty. Walking into the actual hotel (which is on the 3rd floor only) was eery because it was dark, rundown and had a weird old stench to it. With regards to the room - I was scared to walk on the carpet with bare feet. It wasn't one large strip of carpet, but a whole bunch of squares stuck together. The wall paper was coming off the wall and there was a cobweb on the ceiling. The Air Conditioning was like a massive glorified fan which worked worse than a fan. It kept our room at about 30 degrees celsius the entire night - we could barely sleep. They also only work with one taxi service so we went across the street to a nicer hotel and asked them to order us a taxi to the airport for the next morning - they were more than happy to oblige (it was cheaper than the service that Ara Pacis offered). Overall, I would never stay here again. I was actually scared to sleep in that room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ballerina711
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website looked nice and for the price, it seemed like a good deal. WRONG! The first night our AC was broken so they switched us to another room. When we got back to the hotel after a day of sightseeing our room was covered with ants...all over the bed and hearboard. They tried making us stay in another room which was the size of a closet! I have stayed in hostels better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tuterj
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very well located and really comfortable for all our needings during our recent visit to Rome. Ideal location, few minutes walking from the Vatican and the Spanish Steps. Around the hotel is full of restaurants and pubs where we spent our roman nights.Look for the area of Campo dei Fiori, it is the place where to find people and fun.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: jeromesp
Reviews.Content: Despite some bad reviews, we liked this hotel. It is located in the centre of the city and we had two large rooms with all comforts. Good breakfast to start the day and helpful staff. It was really convenient for us, we will syrely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Alexander1973
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, I would recommend it to anyone. The location of the hotel is spectacular! It's right in the heart of Rome. We stayed at this hotel for a fun, relaxing, enjoyable weekend, this hotel made it possible. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel was gorgeous inside and out, day or night. Our room was quiet and comfortable, probably one of the best beds I have ever slept in. The hotel was still very peaceful with all of the many people staying in there. Alexander, Moscow (Russian Federation).

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: nsvetlana
Reviews.Content: For business reasons I had to spend 4 nights in Rome, and that was my first time. My company booked me this hotel and I ve found it convenient and well located. The room was large and clean. Good breakfast in the morning. The hotel is within walking distance from the Spanish Steps and the main shopping area. Definitly a good choose.

Reviews.Title: “romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: valentinna2000
Reviews.Content: I ve decided with my BF to spend few days in Rome, my favourite city! I ve been in Rome many times, when I ve a moment I always try to come here. This time I booked this hotel in internet and I was so happy with iy. Centrally located, beautiful large room and great staff. Moreover we found a very convenient price for the room. We spent 4 nights in this lovely city, dining out, walking around the narrow streets of the center, and shopping...for sure! The hotel is next to Via del Corso and Via Condotti, where to find the best shops of Rome and the best italian labels. Surely it was good to choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Sayantan
Reviews.Content: It was hot in Rome and the hotel was not at all prepared with the airconditioning. They have this standalone AC in the room with a huge duct going out of the window (because of which you cannot close the window). ACs were totally ineffective and it was unbearably hot. To add to this toilet flush was not working. We saw atleast 4 rooms before settling on a room with a "new" AC (which wasn't any good either). So I guess we can say that it was not "problem with a particular room" but decadence in general. I wanted a smoking room, was told that the whole hotel is non smoking but "if you smoke, we don't know" !!!! Stay clear of this place. Not at all worth the money you will pay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear of this place!!”
Reviews.Author: eyee
Reviews.Content: I truly felt from the first moment I walked to that front desk that I was simply inconveniencing the staff. I did not find one staff member at this hotel that would even attempt crack a smile, or be even half pleasant. They were down right rude. The building shown on the picture is not really the whole truth. The so called 'hotel' is burried up on the top floor of this residential building, with very bad and frustrating signage. It took a while just to find where it actually is. The hallway in the hotel start nice and wide, then turn into a narrow white, hospital like corridor you can barely get your suitcase through. There was absolutely no decor in the room... it felt more like a dorm room... meaning white wash dirty walls without even one picture on he wall. For $175 Euros, I was expecting way more. The bathroom was dirty, with the last guests hair all over the floor... disgusting! Vanity shelf was broken off and there was black mold all around the corners of the shower. The WIFI internet does not work in the room... only in the lobby and it only worked the first day. Following days it was down and I was told by the staff that it's not their problem, to call tech support my self. The breakfast was not bad but not one piece of fruit to be found anywhere... even a banana would have been great. The keys on the room door are from the turn of the century and can easily be opened with probably a bread knife, so I did not feel the my belongings were secure at all. Location was decent and I would give that the only upside. Otherwise I would stay clear of this place. Truly a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “delicious”
Reviews.Author: intutat
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours living in Rome reserved us this hotel for a leisure trip I did with my family.. We had 3 rooms on the back side of the building and we really liked our stay. Excellent staff, lovely clean rooms, nice breakfast in the morning. We spent 4 days in Rome walking a lot around, seeing all the magnificence of this wonderful city. We loved the little restaurants in the centre, the friendly roman people..we felt in love for this city. I hope we' ll have the chance to come agin and for sure we will come back in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: thamellino
Reviews.Content: Only by case we discovered this hotel. We arrived in Rome by car and we passed by the hotel and we decided to ask for a family room. They were very helpful and the location and the price given was very convenient. Excellent staff, they helped us to park the car and more during our stay. The room was big as well as the bathroom.We were impressed of the beautiful ceiling dated 18Th Century. We walked from the Hotel to the Vatican, the Spanish Steps, Navona Square and so on..all was very close to us. We liked our stay, we were lucky to find this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: abusfili
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay in Italy we have been travelling to Rome and we spent 3 days in this lovely hotel. It has a great location and we had a big family room.The hotel is really comfortable and we loved our stay. The breakfast is rich and perfect to start a long day in town. Helpful staff.Thanks Claudio at the front desk for all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rome2008Bristol
Reviews.Content: I think the location of the hotel is great, it is in the centre of most things and within walking distance to most of the main sites. The room was very dark and dingy, with very little lighting and in need of decoration. The rooms were clean and linen was changed daily, but the staff were not very helpful and the breakfast could have been better. There were no views of rome from the hotel, like shown in pictures on the hotels own website. Ideal place to stay if you are not after the little luxuries in life, like a cooked breakfast or decent cup of coffee/tea!!

Reviews.Title: “not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: flyingscorpio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-placed for sight-seeing, especially for the Vatican. However, I think the hotel is cashing in on its location and is over-priced for the facilities offered. The hotel corridors are dingy and the whole place needs decorating. The entrance to the hotel does not feel safe, particularly at night-time. The staff are surly and do not offer help willingly. The room was much smaller than shown on the website, and the bathroom was little more than a cupboard. Breakfast was mediocre. The hotel should not be graded as a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “miserable staff”
Reviews.Author: anon083
Reviews.Content: I found the staff on the desk at this hotel very unhelpful, they always seemed very un friendly and miserable. Sometimes not even acknowledging you when you said good morning. I found the lady who brought out the breakfasts also to be very miserable when you asked for a pot of tea, it seemed as if it was too much trouble to her. A cleaner from the hotel kept coming into the dining room from the kitchen and taking food from the table where the guest had to pick their breakfast, the cleaner didnt look very clean and I felt that this practice should not happen. On the whole the hotel was ok, but the staff need replacing for people who have visited to come back or recommend the hotel. I wouldnt recommend or re visit.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay........”
Reviews.Author: WHOAREYOU11
Reviews.Content: It was a convenient hotel wrt the sights of Rome. Only major grievance I have is the fact that I could not book the hotel online for 3 days and on the second day whilst there, they doubled the room rate. Also, I was disgusted with the bed linen........quite filthy even after they changed it at my request.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactorily”
Reviews.Author: Guest0987
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a tolerable place to stay. We got a double room which was not as big as pictures show but adequate and silent with a small bathroom. Breakfast room was crowded about 8 am but not as crowded if you come a little earlier. Breakfast was not bad but standart: croissants, bread, cheese, salame, boiled eggs, some fruits (oranges and apples), yogurt, cornflakes etc. Pluses: easy to reach by bus, not far from subway station; short walking distance to Piazza del Popolo and Vatican City; enough places to eat and shops around. Minuses: not strong pressure of hot water, no safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid headache and hassle. Don't stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sdio2jd
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel in August 2006. We had a confirmed reservation, but when we arrived, they told us they would have to send us across town to another hotel because they had no rooms. The staff person assured us that the other hotel was "much nicer," and pointed to a spot on the map near the city center. They said they had "made special arrangements with this other hotel to take us in." Much to our dismay, the other hotel wasn't much nicer, and even worse, it was located in a totally different part of town than they claimed. We were very disappointed because we could have easily stayed in this much less popular part of town for much less money. The next night, we insisted on being sent back to the Hotel Ari Pacis. They stuck us in a tiny room with broken air conditioning. I travel all the time, and I've stayed in a variety of hotels in the past, but this was by far the worst hotel experience I've ever had in any part of the world in my life. If I were to take a guess, this hotel actually owns the other hotel. The Ari Pacis overbooks intentionally because it's at a lower price point. The other hotel (The Hotel Borromeo) may be under the same umbrella ownership. It's at a higher price point though, so the owners of the Ari Pacis may simply overbook the cheaper hotel, then send the excess guests across town to the other hotel. Whatever is going on, it's a very shady operation, and I don't want any other travelers to have to deal with what my we had to deal with. For your own sake, please DO NOT STAY HERE. If you have to pay more for a comparable hotel in the area, stay in the other hotel. It'll save you a lot of headache and hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only positive”
Reviews.Author: LeeseB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is shabby, run down and managed by unhelpful staff. I has initially booked a single room for 2 nights, but I was told I had to change rooms each night, which was a nuisance. The 'air conditioning' in the second room was merely a fan on a desk. I then was booked into a triple room with friends - the room was clean, but poorly maintained. There was no hot water on their arrival and when we complained and came back, there was still no hot water and the plumber had turned off the air con and on the heat in 36 degrees! Any complaints were poorly dealt with - on one occasion the desk clerk walked away when I was in mid conversation. The location of this hotel is the only thing it has going for it, and on the experience of the rudeness alone, I would not recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT recommend”
Reviews.Author: GKDJHammett
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is located near Vatican City and Spanish Steps, I would not recommend a stay at this hotel. The rooms were smaller than US hotels, but we managed. However, when the hotel says it has "air-conditioning," it is referring to an open window and a teletubbie looking dehumidifier. We had to sleep with the window open to generate cool air and the traffic noise kept us up most of the night. Friends who also stayed at this hotel had mold in their room so overwhelming that they had to frequently leave the room. The staff at the hotel was not friendly or helpful. There are many other hotels in the same area. Keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “great location...adequate acommodations”
Reviews.Author: drewd67
Reviews.Content: The grand foyer of the hotel is quite impressive with an elegant marble staircase and and very tall wooden double doors. The elevator was a bit hidden, but thank god we found them as the actually hotel is located on the third floor. Staff was welcoming upon arrival and fairly helpful. The room we had was ok and just enough room for the four of us. The high ceilings in the room were vaulted and very impressive looking. Unfortunately, the entire hotel is in need of some upgrading as the lock and knob on our door was falling off, which made us a little weary about the security of our belongings when we left the room. Fortunately nothing happened and the hotel seemed to be very safe and secure. Breakfast was mediocre consisting of white bread slices (wonderbread), individually wrapped cheese slices (kraft singles), hard boiled eggs, and store bought pastries. It did the trick though. Location was hard to beat as it was 15 min walk from the Vatican, 10 min walk from Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain, 30 min walk from Coloseum, and just a few steps away to some impressive shopping (ie. Fendi, Gucci, Prada, D&G, the list goes on!) Overall, you get what you pay with this hotel. I was generally pleased with my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place for me”
Reviews.Author: Taleke
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at the Borromeo but willingly moved to the Ara Pacis because my room at the Borromeo wouldn't be ready until 2 hours after I arrived (my stupid mistake for switching hotels). I was dirty and tired from traveling and did not want to start my adventure in Rome sweaty and smelly. I was told by the front desk clerk that their other hotels (all in the same chain) were just as nice. He told me he'd find a ride for me--which he did...a friend of his I believe. Not a hotel employee...a friend. She was nice enough but still... It was located near the Vatican though I wanted to be closer to the Forum. My fault for accepting. Anyway upon arrival at the Ara Pacis I wasn't impressed. The desk clerk was extremely gracious and kind. I had absolutely no problem with the hotel employees. They were all very accomodating. The clerk gave me a double room with a balcony. However, upon entering, my heart sank a bit. My very well-worn room with scratches and brown marks on the wall smelled extremely stale and moldy; the carpet was thrown together on the floor in approximately 14"by 14" squares and not glued down (I could see the cement floor underneath); the bathroom...oh dear...the bathroom. It's ridiculous to even call it that. It was the size of a large closet and the shower, if you can call it that, was simply a drain in the floor with a shower head attached to a wall...less than a foot from the toilet. There was no separate shower space. It was sink, toilet, shower head, shower curtain, drain. The toilet and shower shared the same floor. That's right. The entire floor would be covered by water because THAT was the shower room. Basically, the bathroom was a shower with a toilet in it. When I got into the stale-smelling room I opened windows on the balcony to let in fresh air. I figured since it was a balcony I didn't have to worry about the security of having the doors wide open since the room was on the 4th floor. However, as I was getting dressed a maintenance man came through a little removable gate on one side of the balcony to spray the plants and flowers. Not a big deal...unless you're a single woman getting undressed close to your wide open door! (The room was a bit crowded so I didn't have a lot of room to change) I was horrified. I quickly closed the door and curtains. After this I tried calling the Borromeo to see if I could still have my room (I'd only been in the Ara Pacis for 20 minutes or so) but was told the room had already been taken. Yeah, sure it had. I didn't feel like putting up a fight since I had made plans with friends so I decided to just stay in the room as it was only for one night and consider it an adventure. I was paying $140 per night and expected something similar to the Borromeo which I have stayed in before. The Ara Pacis was not that place. It's very close to the Vatican and St Angelo and there's a bus stop across the street if you don't feel like walking to the Forum, Colloseum, Spanish Steps, etc. I'm sure there are rooms that are fine in the hotel as evidenced by the other moderate reviews. However, I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: Annie3
Reviews.Content: Well located, fifteen minutes walk to Vatican City. Lots of local restaurants, cafes and shops five minutes from the hotel. Access to buses right outside the door. About twenty to thirty minutes walk to the tourist areas; Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Colliseum a little further. Twenty minutes walk to the Spagna stop on the subway. Five minutes to Ponta Cavour and the Tiber River. Single small room with double bed, decent bathroom with shower,clean and well taken care of. Little bit on the rundown side, here and there. Clean linen and towels everyday. Hairdryer, soap, shampoo, notepaper and map of Rome in the room. Rooms were tiny but efficient with desk, chair, wardrobe that locked with key. Small bar refrigerator. Eighty euros per night single occupancy. Continental breakfast buffet every morning at eight A.M., hard crusty rolls, toast, sliced meats, cheese, juice, hard-cooked eggs, coffee etc.. Bread often day old but manageable. Hotel staff helpful and knowledgable, day desk clerk spoke english, french, italian, and some german. Polite and kind if you were not pushy or aggressive with them. Maids and Cook spoke Italian. Few little problems; Doors to rooms made alot of noise, difficult to lock and unlock with ancient keys. Little privacy, walls seemed paper thin. In the two rooms that I stayed in, both small locks on the wardrobes had been forced at one time or another. They locked, but were easy to force open. Carried any money and passport with me, so there was little to steal of any value in my room.

Reviews.Title: “This made our week!”
Reviews.Author: DaleMetcalfe
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - November, unusally warm and beautiful. Room smaller than USA hotels but very adequate. Excellent location - we didn't need a car. Everything is in walking distance. 15 minutes to the Vatican, Colliseum,Trevi, Spanish Stairs, shopping, tons of restaurants,staff was excellent, breakfast very good. Always greeted with a smile- anything we asked help on they delivered. Arranged limo from FCO airport both ways and got us a discount. Fluent in English - really made us feel like family. We will stay with them again. For dinner visit Vito's Irish Pub around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Beware about giving credit card details”
Reviews.Author: factor3
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to warn others to be cautious about giving out credit card details when booking hotels in Rome. I have booked many hotels in Spain etc without being asked for credit card details, however when I recently contacted several hotels in Rome, they all requested that I e-mail my credit card details in order to confirm the booking. I refused to e-mail my card details as it's not secure, but eventually agreed to give them to the Hotel Ara Pacis (one of the Ludoviki chain) through their secure web-site. A few hours before we were due to fly, all flights to and from Rome were cancelled due to a general workers strike in Rome. Out of courtesy we e-mailed the hotel and taxi firm to explain (although they would already have been aware about the strike). A couple of days later I received an e-mail stating that the hotel was going to charge my credit card for 1 night (if I hadn't e-mailed when I did it would have been 2 nights). I attempted to stop the payment, however I was informed by the bank that by me giving my card details to the hotel I was authorising the payment and there was no way I could prevent them from taking the money! I have since e-mailed the Hotel Ara Pacis, Ludoviki Group and Rome Hotel Services (who I booked the hotel through) stating that it is appalling and nothing short of robbery that they have taken this payment, but they have all declined to respond. It is legal for them to take the payment as it is in line with their cancellation policy; however under these circumstances it is certainly unethical. PLEASE BEWARE WHEN YOU OFFER YOUR CREDIT CARD DETAILS YOU ARE AUTHORISING THE HOTEL TO TAKE PAYMENT, AND THE ARA PACIS AND LUDOVIKI GROUP WILL TAKE PAYMENT NO MATTER WHAT THE CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE CANCELLATION ARE (EVEN A GENERAL WORKERS STRIKE WHEN IT IS COMPLETELY OUT OF YOUR CONTROL!!)- SHOULD YOU BE AS UNLUCKY AS WE WERE!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I ve been in Hotel Ara Pacis for 3 nights with my girlfriend and we really liked the Hotel and the location. Great clean room (the ceiling is the from the 18th century!marvellous!!), all comforts, great air conditioning. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast in the morning, rich and plentiful. The location is superb, all is within walking distance. We loved Rome, we loved this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: spirit59
Reviews.Content: Family of four, children aged 12 + 8, we stayed at this hotel in July for 4 nights. Location was excellent. 10 mins walk to the vatican. 10 mins walk the other direction took us to the Trevi / spanish steps etc. Room was basic but clean - we tended to go out from 9am to about 10pm for the sights and then some dinner. Air conditioning system was working. Although a bit bulky and noisy, we all enjoyed a good night's sleep. Breakfast buffet was very good - but I repeat - the location was superb.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the ara pacis in february of 2005 for 4 nights. When we arrived at the hotel we were a day late for our reservation and dead tired from traveling from germany that morning. The wonderful desk clerk Claudio promptly offered us a wonderful breakfast and then let us settle into an upgraded room. It was so beautiful. The hotel itself is moderately classy located on the 3rd floor of a building. They have a functioning elevator which is very helpful. The free breakfast is wonderful in the morning, all of the staff are very welcoming and friendly. The location is awesome. It is only about a 20 minute walk to the colloseum and several other popular destinations are along the way. Walking is a little scary because of the wild drivers in rome but the shopping is wonderful. I would advise you to walk though because you really get to see everything and it is not that far at all. I truly loved our stay at the ara pacis and would definetly stay there again. Hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: RunningMan2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2004. The room was small with only a foot or so space around the bed and had tiny windows. The bathroom was very narrow and basic. The breakfast room (again small) was a joke, only the first few got the croissant and sometimes you had to wait for a table. The staff were often over worked and neglated waiting guests. Possibly the hardest part is finding the entrance from the street as you have to take a hidden lift to reception. All in all below average and we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: PRdiner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ara Pacis for one week in February 2005. We prefer staying at smaller friendly hotels in Europe, so we were looking forward to the Ara Pacis. We were disappointed. I agree with the traveler who said "You get what you pay for". This is a 2 star (not a 3 star) hotel. The breakfasts were very nice, but nothing special. The location is suberb, and for the most part, the hotel is clean. However . . . the accomodations were dated and not very comfortable. The hotel needs upgrading and renovation. For example, the windows did nothing to drown out the noise of trucks and busses throughout the night, the blowdryer in the bathroom was falling apart, housekeeping forgot to give us fresh towels twice, the radiator worked sporadically, the lighting in the room was horrible, and the doors were paper thin and could not insulate us from the loud drunken tourists who were on either side of our room and routinely came in at 1:30 am! Yet, the most disappointing aspect of the hotel was the personnel. Although the breakfast waitresses and the concierge on the late night shift was quite nice, but the day-time concierge was lazy, apathetic and generally inhospitable. He would not even make eye-contact and when I asked him if he could help us make reservations at the Uffizi for our day-trip to Florence, he told me to look up the number myself and call from my room phone. He was no help when we asked him where to purchase bus tickets either. Useless and unfriendly. If not for the location and price, I would not recommend this hotel under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: auldjoke
Reviews.Content: We chose to book the Ara Pacis for three nights to celebrate both our wedding anniversary and my husbands birthday at a cost of £50 per night as they offered "Great rooms, Great rates". The hotel is in a good location, situated in a beautiful building and the hotel foyer impressive. The size of the room we were allocated (room 35), left us both deflated and momentarily speechless!. The room was so small that there was no room to walk up the sides of the bed. Access could only have been by crawling up from the bottom of the bed. A very large wardrobe blocked more than 50% of the access to the toilet and shower room, making it almost impossible to get into (and we are not large people). There was also a very strong smell of paint or some other substance that even if the room had been big enough, would have made it impossible to sleep in. We asked for a different room and were told that we had not paid much money, and this was what we had paid for (remember the advert "Great rooms, Great rates". We were told we could have a larger room (that had been allocated to someone else!) at an additional cost of 30 euros per night. Having no alternative, we paid the money and were given room 10. This was, in my opinion the size of room we had paid for (a standard double). This was apparently their 'double superior' and large enough for 3 people. We would like to be there when they try to put a third bed in. My husband is an engineer and couldn't work it out! This room was dark and noisy, overlooking a very busy road. We were woken up by the bin lorries, sirens, and at 6am, the person in the adjoining room taking a shower. It sounded as though they were in the same room!. The soundproofing between the adjoining rooms and the kitchen across the corridor was appalling. Although clean, the showeroom had mould spores on the tiles, walls and shower cubicle and beware the hole in the floor by the wardrobe!. We did see some very nice spacious rooms in the hotel (when they were being cleaned) but I'm not sure what the criteria for being allocated one of these was (but obviously we didn't meet it). On the plus side, the bed was clean and comfortable (once we had bought some earplugs) and the breakfast was basic but plentiful. Most of the staff were courteous and helpful. Question: Would I return to the Ara Pacis? Answer: Definitely not. There are many hotels in the same area to chose from for the price we paid. Question: Should you stay at the Ara Pacis? Answer: After reading all the reviews, the decision is yours!.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for Price”
Reviews.Author: Branbal77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few months ago. I booked through Hotels.com and found the room for approximatly $100. I read the reviews on here for the hotel,after booking it and was very nervous. The hotel staff are great and the room was as to be expected for being a european room. It was small but I was there to see Rome not to hang out in a hotel. There is no AC, but the hotel provides a floor fan. That and having the window open will give you a nice breeze. Rooms open onto courtyard so noise is minimal. I go to Rome alot right now because we are stationed in Italy and I will definetly stay here everytime. It is a 5 minute walk to Piazza de Spagna and about 25 to Collosium. I would recommend this to any.

Reviews.Title: “Ara Pacis - Great location”
Reviews.Author: neil30
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ara Pacis with family of four July 25th to the 29th. Room was small but clean, Requested balcony room on the web site when booking and was pleased to find it was a total walk out terrace. Total area was 3-4 times the size of the room. Bathroom was update and hot water and presure perfect. Staff were friendly (it helps if you speak Italian, like my wife, but ok if you don't, like me) and request for second in room fan was acted on right away (no AC in our room but double doors opened to terrace so no problem). Elevator is brand new. Location is very good, possible to walk to all sites. Area is very safe, mostly banking and Government offices. There are two little food shops around the back were you can get anything you need at a good price and they speak a little bit of english. Breakfast was ok, Capp. for the parents hot choc for the kids. Nice all round place if you are not looking for to many extras. Left Rome on the 29th by train to the very South (Capo Vaticano) one of the most beautiful places in all of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Did some research and the AraPacis was the only one available in the area we wanted. Unfortunately the price was 180 EU/night. A little steep in our opinion. There is definitely an ambiance and the elevator was very efficient (Sep. 04). However, the A/C was non-existent even though they seemed to think it worked and there was not enough lighting in the room - hard to read. Our room was at the front and it was extremely noisy during night from the motor vehicles on the street. The TV did not get many channels and we could not watch the soccer game. The staff was aloof, breakfast was fine and the location suited us perfectly. We walked to every sight, even the train station. Definitely an average hotel. We will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & courteous lodging”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aris Pacis in July of 2003, after being bounced from my booked hotel, and was glad I ended up there! The staff was exceedingly courteous, doing everything within their means to make my stay as pleasant as possible. The building is centuries old, so the lift (mentioned in several of the other reviews on this site) is small and tempermental, but the hotel is located on the 3rd floor of the building - so it is not overly difficult to reach if walking up and down. My daughter and I made a game of seeing who would reach the top/bottom first if one was in the lift and one ran up/down the stairs. The rooms are small - as with most European hotels, but clean. Our room had a mini-fridge, a color tv, air conditioning, and windows which we could open if we chose. The hotel offers an extended continental breakfast every day, included in the price of the hotel. This consists of various beverages (milk/juice/coffees/tea), cereals, rolls, fruit, yogurt. Enough to satisfy travellers that want to get out and explore their surroundings. The neighborhood is one of the safer and cleaner areas of Rome from what I could see (much more pleasant than the district around Termini Station). The location is very convenient, within walking distance of the Vatican, and the city center, with several buses stopping literally just outside the door of the hotel. There are restaurants and coffee shops nearby, as well as a pharmacy, and a store just around the corner to purchase bus tickets. All in all, my daughter and I were very happy to stay here. The staff made what would have been a bad experience pleasant and enjoyable, and we loved the experience of staying in a building as old as this. We were quite surprised at how easy it was to get to everything from the hotel. All of this for a price that was - if not downright cheap, certainly not exhorbitant!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very inexpensive, I think we paid $93 US dollars a night, what can you really expect? Our room was very small, wasn't exactly a looker, but it did the trick. It had a small bathroom with new fixtures, but sticking with Italian tradition, it had the random,"shower-head in the middle of the room" motif happening. Once you get over how ridiculous that is, it is really fine. The room did not have central air, but they did wheel in a teletubbie-looking portable air conditioner that worked just fine. If you are able to get over the "petite-ness" of the space and the bizarre quirks, you will realize you are getting a pretty good deal in a good location for a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ara pacis”
Reviews.Author: annandron
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Ara pacis on July 26 for 4 nights we had a twin room which was clean and comfortable. We had air conditioning hot water, and the breakfast was great especialy the cappuccino. The staff were friendly and helpful plus there was a new lift, the hotel was idealy situated for all the main sites of interest. We both had a brilliant stay in Rome made even better by the Ara Pacis staff and hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, this place is fine if you care a little about the comfort of your surroundings, but not too much. The whole hotel smelled of smoke...everywhere....it was just everywhere. Then we get to the room and there was no A/C....so we go to the desk and demand a room with A/C because it was promised in our reservation. We were told we could get another room the next day, but when pressed the concierge finally gave us another room. Also, we had a quad and they don't tell you that the other two beds are roll out sofas that feel absolutely terrible. Breakfast was horrific as well. The drain in the shower clogged and water went everywhere, no surprise since the shower looked so old. Only good thing was the location.

HotelInfo.Name: Ara Pacis Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittoria Colonna 11, 00193 Rome, Italy
